glosses: A formal way of addressing a person or people in a formal context or in a starting of a speech, letter, message, memo, etc., honorable, dear, esteemed, fellow

examples.translation: Dear prime minister, what I was trying to say was...

glosses: A formal honorific title used when talking about someone in a formal context

examples.translation: Just as our honorable president has said...

etymology: Learned borrowing from Chagatai سایین (sayın, “good, well, distinguished”), from a Mongolic language (compare modern Mongolian сайн (sajn, “good, well”)). Cognate with Persian صائین (sâ'in, toponym of a settlement in Iran).
